document_data.caption: Hoarbridge and the northern cold road.
document_data.name: Hoarbridge
document_data.mainbody: '''Hoarbridge''' was a [[Waymeet (Narfell)|waymeet]] and end destination of the [[Cold Road]].{{cite book/The Forgotten Realms Atlas|7}}
document_data.Geography: The site lay in northern [[Narfell]] where the route from distant [[Nethentir]] ended on the frozen shores of the upper [[Icelace Lake]]. It lay some {{SI|200|mile|k|long=yes}} north of [[N'Jast]].
document_data.Trade: Hoarbridge owed its location and early importance to the dwarven kingdom of [[Dareth]], as the metal wealth of the [[dwarves]] attracted many men.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|-343}}, Dareth stopped trading in the waymeet of Hoarbridge, for reasons unknown to the [[Nar]] who simply recorded that the "Stout Folk came no more." In reality, a flight of [[white dragon]]s had claimed the upper caverns of the dwarven kingdom, and the dwarves themselves been driven deep below. In time, dwarf and dragon slew each other, thus opening up the way for hunters and woodsmen.
document_data.Inhabitants: The [[Far Quey]] tribe lived north of Hoarbridge on the other side of the Icelace Lake, and the Hoarbridge waymeet was the nearest trading place that the tribe could reach.
